document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic study of the genus Glyphipterix Hübner (Lepidoptera: Glyphipterigidae: Glyphipteriginae) from Mainland China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic study of the genus Glyphipterix Hübner (Lepidoptera: Glyphipterigidae: Glyphipteriginae) from Mainland China

bibRefCitation.author: Moriuti
bibRefCitation.refString: Moriuti, S. & Saito, T. (1964) Glyphipterix semiflavana Issiki and the allied new species from Japan (Lepidoptera: Glyphipterigidae). Entomological Review of Japan, 16, 60 - 63.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Glyphipterix gamma
Moriuti et Saito, 1964
: 62
. TL: Japan (Kyushu);
Heppner, 1982
: 49
;
Diakonoff, 1986
: 318
, Pl. 15 , Fig. 128 1−2 .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This species belongs to the
delta
-group. It resembles
G. dolichophyes
Diakonoff, 1978
and
G. pseudogamma
Arita et Heppner, 1992
superficially and in the male genitalia. But
G. gamma
is bristled in the middle of the diaphragma (
Fig. 19
),
G. dolichophyes
has diaphragma laterally bristled, and
G. pseudogamma
lacks bristles on diaphragma. As is indicated by
Arita & Heppner ( 1992 )
that the antrum of
G. pseudogamma
is larger and stouter, the cestum is comparatively shorter and broader than that in
G. gamma
, and the maculation of the forewing also shows stronger markings than in
G. gamma
. However, the female genitalia of
G. pseudogamma
are not quite distinguishable from those of
G. gamma
in our collections. So
G. pseudogamma
might be a subspecies of
G. gamma
.

Notes. This species is newly recorded for China .
